recipe.title: How to Make Lemon Tart
recipe.intro: Lemon tart is a classic dessert with a tangy lemon custard filling in a buttery pastry shell. It is fresh, zesty, and perfect after a big meal!
recipe.ingredients: plain flour, butter, icing sugar, egg yolks, lemons, caster sugar, eggs, cream
steps: **Make** the pastry: **Mix** flour, icing sugar, and cold butter until it looks like crumbs. **Add** one egg yolk and **press** the dough into a tart tin.
**Chill** the pastry in the fridge for 30 minutes.
**Preheat** the oven to 180 degrees Celsius. **Bake** the pastry shell for 15 minutes until light golden.
**Make** the filling: **Whisk** the eggs, caster sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest together.
**Add** the cream and **whisk** again until smooth.
**Pour** the lemon filling into the pastry shell. **Bake** for 25 minutes until set. **Cool** completely and **dust** with icing sugar before serving!

quiz1.explanation_correct: æ­£è§£ï¼"Chill the pastry in the fridge for 30 minutes."

review.text: Botanic Gardens CafÃ© is a hidden gem in Cairns. It is inside the beautiful botanic gardens. I went there on a Wednesday for lunch. After my sandwich, I ordered the lemon tart. It was fantastic! The lemon custard was smooth and tangy. The pastry was thin and crispy. It had a light dusting of icing sugar on top. The tart was not too sweet, which I like. I sat under a big tree and enjoyed the peaceful garden. A perfect lunch spot away from the busy city.

quiz2.explanation_correct: æ­£è§£ï¼"After my sandwich, I ordered the lemon tart."

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Good afternoon! Welcome in. What can I get for you?

lines.speaker: Oliver
lines.text: Hi! I am looking for something light for dessert. What do you suggest?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Our lemon tart is very popular. It is tangy and not too sweet.

lines.speaker: Oliver
lines.text: That sounds perfect. Is it made fresh today?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Yes, our chef made it this morning.

lines.speaker: Oliver
lines.text: Great, one lemon tart, please. And a pot of green tea.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Good choice! Would you like to sit inside or on the terrace?

lines.speaker: Oliver
lines.text: The terrace, please. It is a beautiful day.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: It is! That will be fifteen dollars.

lines.speaker: Oliver
lines.text: Can I tap? Here you go.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Thank you! I will bring your order to the terrace. Enjoy!

part_a.full_text: How was the lemon tart? It was really good. I loved the tangy flavour. Was it too sour for you? No, it was just right. The sweetness and the sourness were balanced. What about the pastry? The pastry was perfect. Thin and crispy. I want to learn how to make it at home. You should ask the chef for the recipe. That is a great idea. I will ask next time I come here.

part_b.full_text: Hello! We are excited to announce our new weekend baking class. This Saturday, we will teach you how to make a lemon tart from scratch. The class starts at ten in the morning and finishes at one in the afternoon. It costs thirty-five dollars per person. The price includes all ingredients and a recipe booklet to take home. You will make your own tart and take it home with you. The class is for beginners, so no experience is needed. We only have twelve spots available, so please book early. Call us or book online at our website.

try_it.example: Today a customer ordered our lemon tart. She said 'This is the best lemon tart I have ever had!' Her words made my day. I love working at this cafÃ©.
